title:
On the existence of periodic invariant curves for analytic families of
  twist maps and billiards
abstract:
In this paper we prove that in any analytic one-parameter family of twist
maps of the annulus, homotopically invariant curves filled with periodic points
corresponding to a given rotation number, either exist for all values of the
parameters or at most for a discrete subset. Moreover, we show that the set of
analytic twist maps having such an invariant curve of a given rotation number
is a strict analytic subset of the set of analytic twist maps. The first result
extends, in dimension 2, a previous result by Arnaud, Massetti and Sorrentino.
We then apply our result to rational caustics of billiards, considering several
models such as Birkhoff billiards, outer billiards and symplectic billiards.
